plugins.name: Arreglo
plugins.description:
https://arreglo.ai


Arreglo is a Figma plugin that helps music producers visualize song arrangements. Using AI with semantic pattern recognition, it generates musically intelligent arrangements based on your instrument patterns and track names, making it easy to plan and understand song structures.
plugins.tagline: Finish tracks faster with AI generated arrangement ideas!

120469.tagline: Finish tracks faster with AI generated arrangement ideas!

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

plugins.name: DATVM
plugins.description:
DATVM makes it simple to inject realistic and varied data directly into your Figma designs, saving you time and keeping your mockups authentic.


100+ Built-in Datasets

Choose from a wide range of pre-populated categories.


Customizable Lists

Create and manage your own custom lists to perfectly match your project's specific needs.


Sort & Randomize

Sort data alphabetically, by length, or randomize for unique content every time.


Number Formatting

Format numbers with precision. Control decimal places, separators, currency symbols, and percentage variations.


Date Formatting

Easily format dates with customizable separators and order.


Bookmarks

Save your favorite lists for quick and easy access.


How it Works

  1. Select the text layers you want to populate.
  2. Open DATVM.
  3. Choose a data category from the available lists or select a custom list.
  4. Customize formatting options.
  5. Click to populate the selected layers with data.
plugins.tagline: Finest Data Populator

plugins.name: AVA Companion Plugin
plugins.description:
The AvaHub Batch Crop Importer plugin simplifies the design workflow by seamlessly importing crops generated by AvaHub.ai directly into Figma. AvaHub generates precise image crops, and this plugin allows you to batch import them effortlessly into your Figma workspace.


Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.
plugins.tagline: A tool to batch crop your ava images

plugins.name: Memoji Avatar Pack
plugins.description:
Add vibrant personality and diversity to your designs with the Memoji Avatars Library — a massive collection of over 1500 high-quality memoji and avatar illustrations. This plugin lets designers easily find, filter, and insert expressive characters by gender, skin tone, expression, and name — all without leaving your design workspace.


Whether you're creating user profiles, marketing materials, or social media graphics, these versatile memoji avatars help you craft inclusive and engaging visuals faster than ever. Designed for UI/UX designers, illustrators, and creatives seeking an efficient and rich asset library, this plugin is your go-to tool for diverse avatar illustration needs.

accepted.name: Open Wave.io
accepted.description: Open Wave is an open-source organization Founded by Lawrence Okosa III. creating tools that streamline design and development workflows.

plugins.tagline: 1500+ customizable memoji and avatar illustrations at your fingertips.

plugins.name: Export to Google Drive
plugins.description:
Direct export frame to google drive


How to use?


  1. Please select the frame to export.
  2. Run the "Export to Google Drive"
  3. Connect to Google Drive (A new tab will open to authorize this plugin.)
  4. Copy the authorization code from Google and paste it
  5. Enter Google Drive Folder ID
  6. Done! check your dirve!


*From now on, please enter only the folder ID and submit.

plugins.name: GIF Boss
plugins.description:
Bring your designs to life with GIF Boss — the ultimate Figma plugin for creating powerful, customisable GIFs in seconds. Select a series of frames and transform them into smooth, high-quality animations with full control over:

  1. Timing & Looping – Set frame durations and loop styles with ease
  2. Reordering – Drag and drop to perfect your frame sequence
  3. Optimisation – Shrink file sizes without compromising quality
  4. Bulk Creation – Generate several GIFs simultaneously. Ideal for large campaign roll-outs with multiple animated banner ads of different dimensions
plugins.tagline: Simultaneous multi GIF generation.

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? 🕵️‍♀️ Meet Scout, your trusty design detective—ready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. 🎯


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout “Hex!”


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantly—because who doesn't love instant magic? ✨


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue is—no guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system first—it'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.


Scout is currently in beta. Found bugs? Have questions, suggestions, or feature requests? 💌 DM me on Twitter

accepted.name: Satyam
accepted.description: Product and UI/UX Designer | Email me at sat02yam@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Keep Scouting

plugins.name: QuickData
plugins.description:
Easily sync your Figma layers with data from a public Google Sheet. Perfect for batch renaming or inserting text into layers based on column headers.


✅ 1. Prepare Your Google Sheet

Set it to public:

File → Share → Anyone with the link


Make sure the first row contains column headers


For best results, freeze the header row


⚙️ 2. In the Plugin

Paste your Google Sheet URL


Preview your data in a table


Use the refresh button to reload updated data


🧩 3. Setup Layers

Name your layers using: #ColumnName

e.g., For a "Name" column → #Name


Spaces & special characters are auto-removed


🔁 4. Sync Your Data

Select the layers you want to update


Click the “Sync” button


🖊️ Text layers: name & content will update


🧱 Other layers: only name updates


🙌 Support Me

If you found this plugin helpful, consider supporting me:

👉 https://jdip19.github.io/support-jdip.html


💬 Have Feedback or Ideas?

📧 Contact me: ujaydip9@gmail.com


🔗 Follow me on LinkedIn for UI/UX & plugin design updates:

linkedin.com/in/jaydip-upadhyay-32b231176
plugins.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

137348.name: QuickData
137348.description:
Easily sync your Figma layers with data from a public Google Sheet. Perfect for batch renaming or inserting text into layers based on column headers.


✅ 1. Prepare Your Google Sheet

Set it to public:

File → Share → Anyone with the link


Make sure the first row contains column headers


For best results, freeze the header row


⚙️ 2. In the Plugin

Paste your Google Sheet URL


Preview your data in a table


Use the refresh button to reload updated data


🧩 3. Setup Layers

Name your layers using: #ColumnName

e.g., For a "Name" column → #Name


Spaces & special characters are auto-removed


🔁 4. Sync Your Data

Select the layers you want to update


Click the “Sync” button


🖊️ Text layers: name & content will update


🧱 Other layers: only name updates


🙌 Support Me

If you found this plugin helpful, consider supporting me:

👉 https://jdip19.github.io/support-jdip.html


💬 Have Feedback or Ideas?

📧 Contact me: ujaydip9@gmail.com


🔗 Follow me on LinkedIn for UI/UX & plugin design updates:

linkedin.com/in/jaydip-upadhyay-32b231176
137348.release_notes:
## Version 2.0.0 (June 2025)

### Major Changes
- **Streamlined Data Syncing**
  - Simplified the core functionality to focus on direct Google Sheets integration
  - Improved data normalization for sheets with or without frozen headers
  - Enhanced error handling for invalid URLs and data formats

### UI Improvements
- **Tea Cup Animation**
  - Added animated steam effects with three particles
  - Implemented hover animations for the "Buy me tea" link
  - Refined positioning and styling of the tea cup SVG
  - Modified steam animation timing and positions

- **Instructions Modal**
  - Reorganized the "How to use" modal content for better clarity
  - Added clearer sections for:
    - Sheet preparation
    - Plugin usage
    - Layer syncing
  - Included tips about header rows and preview functionality

### Technical Improvements
- **Code Optimization**
  - Removed unused interfaces and functions for better maintainability
  - Streamlined the core data syncing logic
  - Improved error message handling
  - Enhanced logging for better debugging

### User Experience
- **Better Feedback**
  - Added clear success messages with layer count details
  - Improved error notifications with specific failure reasons
  - Added loading states during data fetch operations

### Documentation
- **Plugin Description**
  - Updated cover image text: "Instantly sync your Google Sheets data with Figma layers for seamless content updates"
  - Enhanced usage instructions and examples
137348.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.

plugins.name: Variant Randomizer
plugins.description:
Tired of manually clicking through component variants one by one just to create visual variety in your mockups? Variant Randomizer is here to help! This simple yet powerful Figma plugin lets you instantly randomize the variants applied to multiple selected components or instances that have more than one variant option.


How it Works:

Select multiple elements (components/instances) on your canvas.

Run the [Plugin Name] plugin.

Done! The plugin automatically assigns a random variant to each selected element that has multiple variants available. Elements with only one variant or no variants will be ignored.


Why use Variant Randomizer?

Save Valuable Time: Stop the tedious process of manually changing variants across many elements.

Create Realistic Mockups: Quickly add natural variation to lists, grids, user avatars, button states, icons, and more.

Boost Productivity: Perfect for working with design systems and large sets of components.

Simple & Fast: One-click operation after selection.

Works on Selection: Target only the elements you need to change.



You can help me mantain this plugin by Buying me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: nstantly randomize component variants across your selection.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

plugins.name: Figma 2 FRIDA
plugins.description: Users can select Figma frames to automatically generate clean, functional code for Flutter, React, Kotlin and Angular, with the code adapting to the specific data within the frames. This includes not only the UI components but also layout structures and other relevant data. Additionally, the tool provides the ability to generate automated test cases based on the generated code, helping ensure quality and functionality. For app deployment, users can generate the necessary icon files tailored for various platforms, simplifying the process for app deployment across different app stores and environments.
plugins.tagline: Generate code for both mobile and web based on Figma UI designs.

plugins.name: SuperLayer (copy)
plugins.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It’s ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer’s type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
plugins.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
131488.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

plugins.name: Add Section
plugins.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
plugins.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

131159.description:

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
131159.release_notes:
- Added a way to fix the padding on existing sections (Resize Sections button)
- Fixed a bug where the plugin closed after each use
- Improved performance
131159.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

plugins.name: Refine Selection
plugins.description:
Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma


Transform your selection workflow with this powerful tool that helps you select and deselect layers with precision. Perfect for designers who work with complex designs and need quick access to specific layer types.


Key Features:

• One-Click Selection: Instantly select all layers of a specific type within your current selection

• Alt+Click to Deselect: Hold Alt (or Option) to deselect layers instead of selecting them

• Smart Layer Detection: Automatically identifies and filters:

- Text layers

- All shapes

- Primitives (stars, polygons, lines, rectangles, ellipses)

- Paths

- Lines

- Image layers

- Frame layers

- Components

- Instances


Workflow Benefits:

• Save Time: No more manual selection of multiple layers

• Reduce Errors: Precise selection of specific layer types

• Smart UI: Buttons automatically disable when no matching layers are found

• Intuitive Design: Clean interface with visual feedback


Perfect For:

Designers working with complex layouts

Teams managing large design systems

Anyone who needs to quickly select specific layer types

Designers who frequently work with nested components


💡 Pro Tip: Hold Alt (or Option) while clicking to deselect layers instead of selecting them!


Note: Free version includes rate limiting of 50 selection per minute. Subscribe to remove limitations and support future development.
plugins.tagline: Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma

Export Children 1Click helps you instantly export all Frame layers inside any container (Section, Frame, or Group) as individual image files.

plugins.name: Gename Thai
plugins.description:
Generate Random Thai Names Plugin


Quickly generate random Thai names for your designs! This plugin allows you to select one or multiple text fields and generate random names for males or females, with the option to include or exclude surnames.


❖ Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

❖ Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

❖ Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

❖ Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!


---


สร้างชื่อไทยแบบสุ่มได้อย่างรวดเร็วสำหรับการออกแบบของคุณ! ปลั๊กอินนี้ช่วยให้คุณเลือกข้อความหนึ่งหรือหลายช่อง เพื่อสร้างชื่อสุ่มสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิง โดยเลือกได้ว่าจะมีนามสกุลหรือไม่มี


❖ สร้างชื่อที่ไม่ซ้ำกัน: ให้ชื่อที่สุ่มออกมาไม่ซ้ำกันในแต่ละช่องข้อความที่เลือก

❖ เลือกเพศได้ตามต้องการ: สามารถเลือกชื่อสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิงได้ตามความต้องการ

❖ ตัวเลือกนามสกุล: สามารถเพิ่มนามสกุลไทยให้กับชื่อได้

❖ การใช้งานง่าย: เลือกช่องข้อความ กด "Generate" แล้วชื่อจะถูกเปลี่ยนทันที
plugins.tagline: Generate Thai name

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

117829.name: Recount
117829.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
117829.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
😟 FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


🥳 PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


⌨️ KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

113969.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: Generic Tailwind Generator
plugins.description:
Lasy to write font-size, font-weight, background-color, border-radius and all other generic props in every project ? Me too.


Just run npx generic-css-cli in your local project and run plugin to generate theses classes and focus yourself to what is really important.


The tool is not there to replace you but help you ❤️
plugins.tagline: Generate generic Tailwind css classes for text and shape sync with your local config

plugins.name: BrandLife
plugins.description: Seamlessly integrate your design workflow with BrandLife using the BrandLife Figma Plugin. Effortlessly import files from your BrandLife library directly into Figma and use them in your creative projects. Once your designs are ready, export assets back into BrandLife, ensuring they are correctly organized within the right assets and collections. Simplify collaboration, maintain brand consistency, and keep your assets organized—all from within Figma.
plugins.tagline: Sync files between BrandLife and Figma

115022.description: Seamlessly integrate your design workflow with BrandLife using the BrandLife Figma Plugin. Effortlessly import files from your BrandLife library directly into Figma and use them in your creative projects.
